isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR FILTER (LOCATED INSIDE EVAPORATOR HOUSING)

caution.para: Never force the fresh/recirculate air door open. If door position must be changed, perform the following procedures. Forcing the door will result in a broken door shaft and a costly repair.

step1.para: Remove grille or filter/grille covering HVAC air inlet (1, Figure 27), located in cab cowl tray at base of windshield.
Verify that fresh/recirculate air door is open (4, Figure 28). This can be done by looking into cowl tray air inlet.
If door is open proceed to next step. If door is closed, proceed as follows:

item.para: Turn ignition key to ON position (it's not necessary to start engine),
Set blower speed control on HVAC control panel to OFF, (the fresh/recirculate air door will open),
Turn ignition key to OFF position.

step1.para: Reaching into the HVAC air inlet, located in evaporator housing (3, Figure 28), remove air filter (5) by compressing top of filter, tipping it to the front, and lifting it straight up.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Location of Air Inlet Filter/Grille
Figure 28. Cutaway View of Evaporator Housing

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. FRESH/RECIRCULATE DOOR (SHOWN IN OPEN/FRESH AIR POSITION)

step1.para: With the filter pleats vertical, place filter (5, Figure 28) into evaporator housing (3) through air inlet.

Position bottom of filter as far to the rear as possible (behind the positioning rib in the housing); then compress top of filter and push it to the rear until it is behind top positioning ribs. The filter is in place when it is set behind the positioning ribs at all four corners.
Fit can be verified by grasping a central pleat and gently pulling forward. The filter should be retained by the ribs.
Install grille or filter/grille covering HVAC air inlet (1, Figure 27).
